intro: Azara lanceolata var. chiloensis, commonly known as the Chilean azara, is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to South America. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and features elliptical, leathery leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by round, yellowish fruits. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in temperate climates.
